info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:41PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF FLAT TOPS...ELKHEAD AND PARK MOUNTAINS...AND CENTRAL YAMPA RIVER BASIN... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 441 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Craig to 11 miles north of Meeker and moving northeast at 45 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This squall will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Flat Tops, north central Elkhead and Park Mountains and east central Central Yampa River Basin. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 92 and 105. Colorado 13 between mile markers 57 and 80. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
